intro: Ceropegia laticorona, commonly known as the broad-veined ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its succulent, trailing stems and fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, intricate flowers that are typically white or pale green, with a unique corona structure. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in rock gardens.
